results.title: Snowdonia
results.creator_credit: Idloes Owen, Horace Shepherd, British Council and Inspiration Pictures (GB)
results.brief_description: Some of the loveliest scenery in Wales; the view from the summit of Snowden, historic Conway Castel, the Swallow Falls. Shots of Caeruaroon Castle include the Kings Gate, the ruined Banqueting Hall and the Eagle Tower where the Welsh flag and the Union Jack fly side by side.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Idloes Owen, Horace Shepherd, British Council and Inspiration Pictures (GB)

results.title: Snowdon on camera. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Iain Johnstone and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Lord Snowden, a well known photographer examines varying techniques and discusses the work of two photographers who have influenced him. He emphasises the importance of the eye rather than the camera and challenges the claim that photography requires complicated equipment and lighting. He also discusses the value of photographs to different people.
results.description: Lord Snowden, a well known photographer examines varying techniques and discusses the work of two photographers who have influenced him. He also discusses the value of photographs to different people.

results.creator_credit: Eugene W. Castle and Castle Films

results.title: Snow camp
results.creator_credit: National Fitness Council of Tasmania and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: Aimed at the experienced bushwalker, this film discusses survival in the snow country. Includes instructions on the building of igloos and other shelters. Suitable for upper secondary and teertiary levels.

results.title: Snow
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of a snow blanketed countryside, trees laden with snow, snow melting on bushes, a mountain stream half-covered with snow and ice and footsteps in the snow. No narration - music only. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Snow
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Jones, Edgar H. Anstey and British Railways
results.brief_description: An impressionistic film, with no commentary and with visuals set against a rhythmic music background. Shows a train ploughing through snow country and the work of track gangs to maintain services during a severe winter. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Jones, Edgar H. Anstey and British Railways

results.title: Snakes and how they live
results.brief_description: Relates major pertinent concepts about snakes, using a great variety of types to show how they move, eat, shed skin, etc. An open-ended approach stimulates class discussion. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Snacks count too
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: What you eat makes a difference - proper nutrition is still a problem. This film examines the factors that lead to excess snacking and further explains the nutritive elements of popular snack foods.

results.title: Smoking: Pete Ennis doesn't smoke yet
results.brief_description: Explores the varius pressures and forces which may tend to influence an individual’s decision on whether or not to smoke. Considers the medical aspects of smoking and points out that the longer an individual smokes the harder it is for them to stop. Designed to promote discussion about smoking.
